steps.content: Choose a sweet caption to show off your boo in the city of rom-coms. steps.title: Borrow a caption from any of the many people whoâ€™ve written about NYC.
steps.content: Borrow a caption from any of the many people whoâ€™ve written about NYC. Practically every modern author, artist, poet, playwright, and screenwriter has written about New York in some shape or form. There are countless plays, books, movies, and television shows that take place in the world-famous city, so you have your pick of quotes to choose from for your Insta captionâ€”-here are some examples to get you started: [13] X Research source â€œOne belongs to New York instantly, one belongs to it as much in five minutes as in five years.â€ â€“ Tom Wolfe â€œThe city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, in its first wild promise of all the mystery and the beauty in the world.â€ â€“ F. Scott Fitzgerald â€œThere is something in the New York air that makes sleep useless.â€ â€“ Simone de Beauvoir â€œI get out of the taxi and itâ€™s probably the only city which in reality looks better than on the postcards.â€ â€“ MiloÅ¡ Forman â€œNew York had all the iridescence of the beginning of the world.â€ â€“ F. Scott Fitzgerald â€œWhen you leave New York, you are astonished at how clean the rest of the world is. Clean is not enough.â€ â€“ Fran Lebowitz â€œIn New York, youâ€™ve got to have all the luck.â€ â€“ Charles Bukowski â€œNew York is the meeting place of the peoples, the only city where you can hardly find a typical American.â€ â€“ Djuna Barnes â€œThe true New Yorker secretly believes that people living anywhere else have to be, in some sense, kidding.â€ â€“ John Updike â€œAnything is possible. This is New York.â€ â€” Sex and the City "My family's in Floridaâ€¦I'm inâ€¦New York?" â€“ Home Alone 2: Lost in New York "You're not a real New Yorker until you've killed a cockroach with your bare hand." â€“ How I Met Your Mother "I'd like a cheeseburger, please, large fries, and a Cosmopolitan!" â€“ Sex and the City "Some might call this a fustercluck. But on the Upper East Side, we call it Sunday afternoon." â€“ Gossip Girl "VIP is always better." â€“ Inventing Anna "This city, this whole country, is a strip club. You've got people tossing the money, and people doing the dance." â€“ Hustlers "Florals? For Spring? Groundbreaking." â€“ The Devil Wears Prada "I like him like I like the Statue of Liberty." â€“ Will & Grace â€œGive me the streets of Manhattan!â€ â€“ Walt Whitman â€œI can get around a city like New York, but I sometimes need a point in the right direction.â€ â€“ Scent of a Woman â€œYou don't like it? Hey, you know you're not the only cockroach in New York City.â€ â€“ An American Tail

steps.title: Choose a line from an iconic NYC anthem to use as your caption.
steps.content: Choose a line from an iconic NYC anthem to use as your caption. From Taylor Swift and Lin Manuel-Miranda to Leonard Cohen and Ella Fitzgerald, there are countless talented songwriters and musicians that have been inspired enough to pen tracks about the city that never sleeps. Any of these lyrics will make from a cute, cool, and culturally-inspired caption for your IG post: [14] X Research source "To be young and in love in New York City" â€“ Lauv "The lights are so bright, but they never blind me" â€“ Taylor Swift "I want to be a part of it, New York, New York" â€“ Frank Sinatra "No matter where I go, I know where I came from (from the Bronx)" â€“ Jennifer Lopez "These streets will make you feel brand-new, big lights will inspire you" â€“ Jay-Z and Alicia Keys "Times Square can't shine as bright as you." â€“ Plain White T's â€œWelcome to New York. Itâ€™s been waiting for you.â€ â€“ Taylor Swift â€œNew York Cityâ€™s the place where they said, â€˜Hey, babe, Take a walk on the wild sideâ€™â€ â€“ Lou Reed â€œI want to wake up in a city that never sleeps.â€ â€“ Frank Sinatra â€œNew York, concrete jungle where dreams are made of, thereâ€™s nothinâ€™ you canâ€™t do now youâ€™re in New York.â€ â€“ Jay-Z and Alicia Keys â€œNo sleep 'til Brooklyn.â€ â€“ Beastie Boys â€œNew York, I love you, but you're bringing me down / But you're still the one pool where I'd happily drown.â€ â€“ LCD Soundsystem â€œI remember you well in the Chelsea Hotel.â€ â€“ Leonard Cohen â€œYou must take the â€˜Aâ€™ trainâ€ â€“ Ella Fitzgerald and Duke Ellington â€œHistory is happening in Manhattan and we just happen to be in the greatest city in the world!â€ â€“ Hamilton â€œThey say the neon lights are bright on Broadwayâ€ â€“ George Benson â€œNew York City, center of the universeâ€ â€“ Rent â€œAnd now I'm in a plane to New Yorkâ€ â€“ Rigoberta Bandini â€œWoke up, it was a Chelsea morningâ€ â€“ Joni Mitchell â€œThere's a breeze off the Hudson / Just when you think you're sick of living here / The memory floods in / The morning light off the fire escapes / The nights at Bennett Park blasting Big Pun tapes.â€ â€“ In the Heights â€œI come into New York town / People going down to the ground / Buildings going up to the sky.â€ â€“ Bob Dylan
